revised_title: The Role of Phosphates in Yeast Fermentation
tldr: The authors discovered that adding a soluble phosphate to a glucose and yeast-juice mixture increases the rate of fermentation. They found that phosphates play a crucial role in the fermentation process, as they are converted into a hexosephosphate during the initial period of fermentation. This hexosephosphate is then slowly hydrolyzed, releasing phosphates that can participate in the fermentation process again, leading to an increased fermentation rate. The authors suggest that the entire fermentation process may be due to this cycle of phosphate reactions.
